dubious.translation[0].definitions[0].de: probably not honest, true, right etc
dubious.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious.
dubious.translation[0].definitions[1].de: not sure whether something is good or true
dubious.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I can see you are dubious; take some time to think about it.
‘Are you sure you know what you are doing?’ Andy said, looking dubious.
Some universities are dubious about accepting students over the age of 30.
dubious.translation[0].definitions[2].de: not good or not of good quality
dubious.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The room was decorated in dubious taste.
